name: Jumeirah Himalayas Hotel Shanghai

reviews.text: The room was quite good, bed was comfortable,and the service was good too, but the buffet breakfast was so bad that not even up to a 4 stars hotel standard.
reviews.title: Not up to a five stars hotel standard

reviews.text: We checked into a 2-bedroom suite on the executive floor of the hotel. Hotel conveniently located in Pudong, only a 20 min ride from the Bund. The architecture and interior design of the building is superb - taking into consideration of chinese culture (trees, clouds & feng shui) and the comfort of a top tier 5 star hotel. Hotel lobby center stage is another piece of antique which feature live Chinese music every evening. On Friday evenings, they even feature belly dance-I guess this may be a Middle east tradition. There are plenty of original antique paintings, calligraphy hanging everywhere you look. Lots of gadgets in the room - everything electronically controlled - blinds and roller blinds. It is really more than a hotel - it is a cultural experience.
reviews.title: I highly recommend Jumeirah Himalayas Shanghai

reviews.text: I stayed at the Jumeirah Himalayas last week on a trial stay basis with my family. The hotel is truly a five star experience, from the lobby, to the rooms and the facilities though there are still some minor renovations in progress. I was lucky to be given a suite room which was split by bedroom section and lunge/dining area, fittings were good and the layout is very open plan, only downside is the view (though in this area there is only views of the exhibition centre. Favourite restaurant I tried was the grill room with a good selection of starters and steaks. Facilities were good with an excellent spa (within changing rooms) and gym. swimming pool though needs deckchairs etc... to make it seem less of a bsic lap pool.
reviews.title: Great trial stay

reviews.text: Highly recommended if you have business at the near exhibition and want a luxury experience.
reviews.title: Major teething problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new hotel next to the Exhibition Center and Line 7 of the Metro provided me with a problematic stay over my 3 nights there. The hotel is plush, modern and hi-tech, but there were frequent brief power outages. Unfortunately, when power returned, it caused all room lights to come on when they were previously off at the master switch. This meant during my 1st night, being woken by lights turning on, and twice on the second (at 1 and 3 am). Reports to engineering did not resolve this and I was eventually moved to another room where the problem did not occur, although the air-con did not work properly and the room remained warm all night. Management were helpful and offerred to not charge for one night, but ultimately I would have preffered to have slept well. Business center not open at time of review.
reviews.title: unique luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new hotel brings Jumeirah's well deserved reputation for outstanding quality and service to Shanghai. Although a little inconvenient for the main areas of the city, the Jumeirah Himalaya is very close to the Maglev station for easy and rapid access to and from the airport and has a line 2 metro station at the doorstep making getting to the main sights and business areas very easy.
reviews.title: Arabian Hospitality in the Orient

reviews.text: The rooms are very well furnished and equipped, illy coffee machine, ipod/ipad connections, luxurious bathroom, comfortable beds etc and the public areas visually stunning both internally and externally. The central stage in the lobby looked a little temporary and probably heralds a more permanent installation, but at present provides a venue for a rather incongruous but popular mix of chinese orchestra and belly dancing performance.
reviews.title: Nice new hotel

reviews.text: The Chinese themed decor is outstanding but we wondered perhaps in a city full of Chinese hotels if an arabic style might have been more appropriate.
reviews.title: Good Hotel near Exhibition place

reviews.text: Whilst the decor, furnishings and design were certainly special, it is the quality of service, from the entire staff from the doorman to the cleaners which make this a special hotel. All without exception were knowledgeable, helpful, attentive and appeared genuinely interested in making you feel welcome, something which can often be lacking in this region.
reviews.title: the true feeling of being in China

reviews.text: Shame about the name though and also that because of the hotel's newness the restaurants on the upper levels were rather deserted
reviews.title: New hotel - still working out the kinks.

reviews.text: Knowing the hotels well from my days in Dubai, I arrived with a sense of curiosity and high expectation, and yes they delivered. Wonderful Tibet inspired deco. Stunning food at the Grill and great service at the lobby. Smiling friendly staff and traditional decorated yet modern & sexy rooms. A must to stay & visit
reviews.title: Great experience, up to Jumeirah's reputation

reviews.text: We stayed only one night here at the Jumeirah Himalayas, but it was a fantastic stay. We were staying on the executive floor, so we were 'checked-in' in our room. the room was large, modern, comfortable with hints of classic chinese design. The bathrooms were huge and beautifully designed with toiletries by Aqua di Parma. the bed was so comfortable that (with help from the automatic black out blinds) it was really hard to get out it the next morning!
reviews.title: Great Luxurious Hotel

reviews.text: the health club is really terrific with a small but well equipped gym and a locker room which includes a sauna and an ice room.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay indeed!

reviews.text: The Wagyu steak at the Grill restaurant was superb, cooked to perfection and served with tempura batter fries!
reviews.title: Sensational Hotel in Pudong

reviews.text: Service throughout is what you would expect from a 5 star deluxe hotel. Location is great for the shanghai expo center and is near a metro station which can whisk you downtown in about 30 mins.
reviews.title: Dubai Luxury meets Chinese Feng Shui

reviews.text: I was more than surprised with the level of services provided at this hotel, they were very attentive and more than ready to help me as soon as I entered the hotel. It's a top quality facility with top services to go together and I would definitely stay again here.
reviews.title: Top services Top facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed one night with my husband in this hotel after a busy week .Decided to relax . I was so happy to be in the room as it is really a nice spacious room . Made me feel like home.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Professional

description: Jumeirah Himalayas Hotel Shanghai has won the International Hotel of the Year in the European Hospitality Awards 2012 which took place in London on November 2nd. The European Hospitality Award celebrates excellence in the hospitality industry, with the winners selected by panel of specialist judges. The award for the International Hotel of the Year is open to all countries outside of Europe.
